title: 2024 grads, when do companies stop coming?
content:
Hi I have my cgpa just in excess of 7. There are 100s of students with 8+ who are yet to get placed. I'm getting anxious as to if I will ever get a chance. I am primarily looking for internship in 8th semester. 
Most of the companies which come right now, do gpa based shortlisting,even t2 companies.
Are there companies that hire for non tech roles?
I don't care about pay right now. I am looking for a job in a decent company.
I'm a cse grad by the way.

comments.body: ive seen my friends with 7.6 get shortlisted and after that its on them , few with 7.8 have even gotten placed.

25 grad here , I don't think the situation will change anytime soon because people with 8.5+ don't really want T2 or barely T1 jobs and they'll keep that deadlock till November because they'll still apply for those jobs and will screw up in HR rounds.
True man, it sucks this is ridiculous. I know quite a people with 6 who got placed. But I'm looking for the right company. Someone who values a bit of non tech skills.
I'd say go for Big4 because I don't see any other major non tech companies coming on campus rn.
